Modules

blimpcontrol - A Python library for the Falcon Flight controller board.

blimpcontrol.init(i2c_bus: int = 1, accel_addr: int = 104, gyro_addr: int = 104, mag_addr: int = 16, motor_pins: dict[str, dict[str, int]] | None = None, gpio_warnings: bool = False) → tuple[Accelerometer, Gyroscope, Magnetometer, dict[str, Motor]]

Initializes the blimpcontrol library, setting up sensors and motors.

This function configures the GPIO mode (BCM), disables warnings, and initializes the accelerometer, gyroscope, magnetometer, and up to 4 motors with specified or default I2C addresses and GPIO pins.

Parameters:

  • i2c_bus (int) – The I2C bus number for the sensors. Defaults to DEFAULT_I2C_BUS.

  • accel_addr (int) – The I2C address for the accelerometer. Defaults to DEFAULT_ACCEL_ADDR.

  • gyro_addr (int) – The I2C address for the gyroscope. Defaults to DEFAULT_GYRO_ADDR.

  • mag_addr (int) – The I2C address for the magnetometer. Defaults to DEFAULT_MAG_ADDR.

  • motor_pins (dict[str, dict[str, int]], optional) – A dictionary defining the pins for each motor. If None, uses DEFAULT_MOTOR_PINS. Example: {"motor1": {"pin1": 17, "pin2": 18}, ...}

  • gpio_warnings (bool) – Whether to enable GPIO warnings. Defaults to False.

Returns:

A tuple containing the initialized (Accelerometer, Gyroscope, Magnetometer, motors_dict).

Return type:

tuple[Accelerometer, Gyroscope, Magnetometer, dict[str, Motor]]

Raises:

  • ImportError – if RPi.GPIO is not available and not being mocked.

  • ValueError – if motor_pins configuration is invalid.

Example:

>>> from blimpcontrol import init, Accelerometer, Gyroscope, Magnetometer, Motor
>>> accel, gyro, mag, all_motors = init()
>>> motor1 = all_motors["motor1"]
>>> motor1.spin_forward(100)
>>> print(accel.get_xyz())
blimpcontrol.get_accelerometer() → Accelerometer

Returns the initialized Accelerometer instance.

blimpcontrol.get_gyroscope() → Gyroscope

Returns the initialized Gyroscope instance.

blimpcontrol.get_magnetometer() → Magnetometer

Returns the initialized Magnetometer instance.

blimpcontrol.get_motor(name: str) → Motor

Returns a specific initialized Motor instance by name.

Parameters:

name (str) – The name of the motor (e.g., “motor1”).

Returns:

The Motor instance.

Return type:

Motor

Raises:

  • KeyError – if the motor name is not found.

  • RuntimeError – if motors are not initialized via blimpcontrol.init().

blimpcontrol.get_all_motors() → dict[str, Motor]

Returns the dictionary of all initialized motor instances.
